Diagnosis: Infectious Endocarditis with Embolic Phenomena Justification: Embolic skin lesions (petechiae, purpura) and systemic symptoms can result from vegetations shedding septic emboli, with possible respiratory symptoms if emboli involve pulmonary vasculature.  7.
